data.title: excellent food but very slow service
data.text: The food was excellent but service was very slow as the bar seemed severely understaffed.  Greater focus was placed upon bar patrons rather than those wanting a meal.  The crab mac and cheese, though, was excellent!  Fortunately we could watch a baseball game as we were stuck waiting for our meal for extended periods of time.

owner_response.author: , Director of Rooms at Lobby Court Coffee Bar & Lounge at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear 409shanei, 

Thank you for taking the time to share with us your experiences at our Restaurant and Bar. I would like to apologize for the slow service as well as the negative service you experienced, we are in the process of addressing this issue with our team. 

I am pleased to hear you enjoyed the crab mac and cheese as this is one of our favorites as well. Thank you again for your feedback and for choosing the Renaissance Seattle. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future. 

Best Regards, 
Brandon M. 
Director of Rooms
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great for Lunch
data.text: Most of the menu is from Maxwells, but they have other choices also. We had lunch there twice. The server was very friendly, and helpful. Wasn't happy about the automatic 20 % tip added to the check, but I would have given it anyway. Clean, nice atmosphere for lunch. The Blackened Salmon on Ciabatta bread was excellent with the sweet potato fries.  We recommend it.

data.title: Good place to unwind
data.text:
Decided to visit one afternoon to relax a bit before returning to the rat race. 

They have a good list of beverages and comfortable sofas and chairs.

Good place to relax.

data.title: Convienient meeting place
data.text: A good place to meet others staying at the hotel or visitors coming to see guests. Service was fairly fast and friendly.

data.title: Super service, nicely decorated
data.text: We stayed at the Renaissance and enjoyed the bar both evenings as well as coffee in the morning.  Service is excellent.  The food served had a good variety and was very good.  Nice place to stop for a cocktail.

data.title: We arrived late and the Bar/Lounge a great place to grab a bite
data.text: After a long day of traveling we finally arrived at the around nine, the lounge was thriving, we found seats and managed to have a few great beers and late night bite to eat. Friendly staff, great beer and food.

data.title: Great happy hour
data.text: The happy hour at the Lobby Court Coffe Bar and Lounge is great.  It last till around 11:00pm and they have many options for drinks and the drink of the day.  The service is friendly and knowledgeable and the drinks are a good value for the money.  The bar is quiet and comfortable, and there are some nice lounge chairs and small places to sit and relax.

data.title: Tasty & convenient
data.text: Excellent snacks and drinks, easy for anyone staying in the hotel or people stopping by to visit. Nice service, quick delivery of food and drinks.

data.title: Regular one
data.text: The service was quite slow and the food not as great as I expected. Just the regular restaurant however not very expensive. Was there few times as this was the closest for me.

data.title: Convenient
data.text: Tried this out for coffee and a quick snack.  A  little pricey but very convenient.  Good coffee!  Nice atmosphere with comfortable places to sit.

data.title: You absolutely have no need to go out for drinks and noshing when you have this place right in the lobby!
data.text: What an awesome experience! The staff in the lounge is top-notch! Super friendly, playful, great attitude, and the best part, they remember your drink the next night you come in!

data.title: Great staff, convenient for staying in the Renaissance hotel, pricy food for the quality
data.text: The staff was very attentive to our needs and engaged us in conversation on this late evening business stay.  My club soda with lime was free but they more than made up for it on my associates drinks.  Good bar food appetizer but again the price was a little high for what you get.  Your paying for the convenience as a hotel guest.

data.title: a little pricey
data.text: Very good service, but very pricey for appies and drinks. It is a very relaxed atmosphere, very nicely decorated and comfy seating

data.title: Good choice for a small plate
data.text: We stayed at the Renaissance and had the opportunity to eat lunch here and stop for after dinner drinks.  Their flatbread was very good and we enjoyed the ambience for after dinner drinks.  Great to have a nice bar where you are staying.

data.title: Great Place for Light Fare
data.text: My husband and I just wanted a late lunch snack and a glass of wine and this fit the bill.  It's comfortable and the menu selections are quiet good:  try the chicken quesadillas.

data.title: Great drinks
data.text: The Lounge is well appointed with couches and chairs and tables. The cocktails are very good as well as the fairly priced snacks and food.

data.title: Best part of our stay
data.text: Spent the weekend at this hotel.  Sunday evening got a little hungry and went down to this bar about 8:30.  Had some of the best wings I've had in a long time!

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Lobby Court Coffee Bar & Lounge at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for the second review. I do appreciate your positive feedback on our chicken wings. I will share your comments with my Exec chef and his team.

Again thank very much.


Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Point of gathering
data.text: Located in the lobby. They have a limitted menu. The flatbread is good and of course they have starbuck coffee.  Good place to gather in the morning or afternoongrab a coffee and continue exploring Seattle.

owner_response.author: Rene N, General Manager at Lobby Court Coffee Bar & Lounge at Renaissance Seattle Hotel, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for your business and your review of the lobby court bar.

I hear your comments  about the limited menu. We will take that in to consideration on our next menu review. in the meantime  we have the 28th floor R view lounge were we have a more substantial menu offering for dinner or Maxwell on the 2nd floor for a full breakfast buffet and menu.

Again thank you for sharing with us and I hope you will be back soon.

Rene Neidhart
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Happy Hour NOT so happy!
data.text: Just that weird vibe when you have to go to the bar to place your order, then they take forever to bring it to you, and when you have to chase someone down to get your check, they forgot to add one of your drinks, and aren't even appreciative when YOU, the customer, points this out to them!  Guess I should have endured the rudeness, and enjoyed a free glass of wine on them!

data.title: Cozy but limited
data.text: Cozy little bar/resto but limited beers on tap and food menu was very condensed. Also, could use a bit more cosmopolitan touch with the food. Great hotel but the lobby bar has not joined the 21st century!
